I don't know if it's related but the following happend to me when tryiung to 
commit:

1) Got prompted for password for extssh connection and entered the password
2) Maybe it was a good password and maybe it wasn't but I got prompted again.
3) Entered the password again and got an authentication error dialog
4) Tried to commit again and it worked.

The password I entered in step 3 must have been right so I shouldn't have 
gotten the error.

Is it reprodusible easily?
I tried, but I could not.
How about the checkbox for 'save password'?

so I can't dupe the error to the DOS console. I tried a bunch of different
scenarios. However, I was able to get the following printed to the console after
I tried to authenticate too many times with the wrong password.

SSH_MSG_DISCONNECT: 2 too many failed userauth_requests 

ymnk, could you do a quick review of your code to see if you are printing stuff
to stdout? If possible you could add these to the exceptions instead.

Comment for #3
I have updated jsch-0.1.16.jar on CVS repository and
it will not print 'SSH_MSG_DISCONNECT...' to stderr.
